attributes.action: request East Midlands Trains to deliver on their promise of "creating a distinctive and even better customer experience" for all customers.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Jake Kelly, Customer Services Director of East Midlands Trains said in a press release dated 27 September 2007 prior to taking over the franchise

"I am excited by the challenge of taking the best of both Midland  Mainline and Central's legacies and, together with my team, creating a distinctive and even better customer experience for our passengers."

From  15th December 2008 the peak time  07.08  Lincoln to London  train will no stop calling at stations between Rolleston and Carlton.  This will make it much harder for commuters living in rural areas to make onward connections to places such as Birmingham,  Derby and Leicester. 

East Midlands Trains should deliver on their  promise by providing an improved customer experience for all customers and not just those living in larger towns.
